reviews.text: Chicago connections are many for the Bill Murray classic that’s funny, poignant and way better than sweet vermouth on the rocks, with a twist.
reviews.author: Richard Roeper

reviews.text: As home releases and re-releases start to fall into a bit of an endless cycle, it makes a weird bit of sense that Groundhog Day would lack a certain excitement and feel like more of what we’ve seen, yet still bring about a little bit of joy.
reviews.author: Douglas Davidson

reviews.text: Nothing suggested that this would gather steam over time and emerge as one of the most respected comedies of the past 30 years.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: This delightful romantic comedy, directed by Harold Ramis, is rich in fantasy and unexpectedly funny twists.
reviews.author: Peter Stack

reviews.text: Groundhog Day is a Scrooge-like comedy that's surprisingly delightful. It poses a very interesting question: What would happen if every day were the same?
reviews.author: Marylynn Uricchio

reviews.text: There's a purity to Groundhog Day that we rarely see in movies... It's civilized, as well as the perfect entertainment of the moment.
reviews.author: Joe Baltake

reviews.text: This sweetly surrealist comedy is, arguably, Murray's most irresistible effort. Groundhog Day is a warm and rewarding story about reason, reckoning, and romance.
reviews.author: Roger Hurlburt

reviews.text: Director Harold Ramis handles the situation beautifully. A potentially silly premise takes on Capraesque qualities and delights.
reviews.author: Bruce R. Miller

reviews.text: Groundhog Day could have been a dull one-joke film, but Murray and Ramis make it work by doggedly pursuing the implications of their outlandish premise.
reviews.author: Scott Rosenberg

reviews.text: This is without doubt the wittiest Bill Murray film ever, filled with verbal, physical and even thematic gags that satisfy on several levels simultaneously.
reviews.author: Robert W. Butler

reviews.text: Groundhog Day is a charming and hilarious film. Or did I already say that? Anyway, it is worth repeating.
reviews.author: Joe Holleman

reviews.text: What [Bill Murray] really wants is to be corny. He achieves his goal in this amusing, sentimental, sometimes slack but thoroughly entertaining comedy.
reviews.author: John Powers

reviews.text: Groundhog Day might have been a mere gimmick movie, but it isn't; it's something better -- a gentle fantasy of both paralysis and liberation.
reviews.author: David Denby

reviews.text: Groundhog Day is a fresh and inventive film filled with laughs and thought-provoking ideas. I loved it.
reviews.author: Gary Wolcott

reviews.text: Occasionally, Groundhog Day buries its head in dumb-comedy clichés. But the film-makers have depended mostly on witty dialogue, and on the simple elegance of the premise -- which could be about anyone whose days all start to seem the same.
reviews.author: Brian D. Johnson

reviews.text: This is an exceptionally sparky film. It uses the medium of cinema as only cinema can be used -- to re-edit reality. It restores a fresh breath of fantasy to the generally stale air of the sitcom world.
reviews.author: Alexander Walker

reviews.text: Groundhog Day is an intriguing fable that almost overstays its welcome but never quite folds up under scrutiny.
reviews.author: Derek Malcolm

reviews.text: Even at its most negligible, Harold Ramis' film is intensely cinematic, not because he is some kind of genius director -- he's not -- but because in the end it's down to film language whether the hero is in hell or in heaven.
reviews.author: Adam Mars-Jones

reviews.text: Groundhog Day combines Saturday Night Live shtick with Twilight Zone weirdness, and when it works, it's hilarious... Two-thirds of the way through, however, Groundhog Day turns syrupy, ruining much of the fun.
reviews.author: Rene Rodriguez

reviews.text: Groundhog Day is the best vehicle for his brand of silly psychosis since Murray tangled with that pesky gopher in Caddyshack. It's a novel, fanciful comedy premise that sails over any shortcomings because it lets Murray be Murray.
reviews.author: Steve Persall

reviews.text: Murray's success here is also the film's undoing. This is his vehicle, and the rest of the cast, as well as the town itself, becomes his straight man.
reviews.author: Bill DuPre

reviews.text: It's unlikely anyone but the maniacal Murray could have pulled this film off. He is one of the few actors around who can crack up an audience just lying alone in bed -- asleep.
reviews.author: Bill Brownstein

reviews.text: From a single dramatic idea familiar to readers of science fiction, Ramis and his co-writer Danny Rubin have fashioned an inventive, discreetly moral comedy of ideas that encourages you to think as you laugh.
reviews.author: Philip French

reviews.text: Groundhog Day goes nowhere very slowly.
reviews.author: Noel Taylor

reviews.text: Groundhog Day has few side-splitting moments, but contains a steady diet of small laughs. It is also the first film for Mr. Murray that thoroughly combines his comedic talents with romantic situations.
reviews.author: Martin Renzhofer

reviews.text: Groundhog Day is not a comedy classic. But it should make you laugh. In these days of unfunny humor and hilarious drama, that's no small feat. With or without practice.
reviews.author: Dan Webster

reviews.text: That it works so entertainingly is a tribute to an ingenious script -- which gradually turns the film into an unconventional romantic comedy and, almost miraculously, never runs out of steam -- and to a pair of very likable performances.
reviews.author: Lynden Barber

reviews.text: Groundhog Day is clearly fashioned after those Frank Capra fables of the '40s in which everyone finally learns a lesson about human nature, but the screenplay smartly balances the sentimentality with cynicism.
reviews.author: Terry Lawson

reviews.text: Unlike many of today's forced, effects-heavy comedies, Groundhog Day has an easy, natural feeling. It's probably a sign of maturity in Ramis and Murray that they work together so effortlessly and winningly.
reviews.author: Dennis King

reviews.text: Kafka meets Capra as Ramis inventively seizes the abundant comic opportunities of this marvelous premise, resulting in a moving and mesmerizing cross between It's A Wonderful Life and an episode of television's The Twilight Zone.
reviews.author: Michael D. Reid

reviews.text: Ramis has always been a smart comedy writer, but his direction is a revelation. After directing the simplistic Caddyshack, no one would have foreseen such a smooth, confident, comedy gem.
reviews.author: Rob Lowing

reviews.text: Despite miscastings in the main roles (Bill Murray and Andie MacDowell) and an off-putting title, this is an engagingly inventive romantic comedy about déjà vu.
reviews.author: Neil Jillett

reviews.text: Murray's goofy frat-boy persona serves him well as he takes us through Phil's fuming, fighting and, finally, reformation.
reviews.author: Bob Ross

reviews.text: The repetition and predictability of Groundhog Day is its biggest drawback, though it's often overcome by the likability and freshness of Bill Murray's performance.
reviews.author: Jack Garner

reviews.text: With Bill Murray delivering the most mature performance of his career, it has a romantic charm to match its freshness and its constant good humor.
reviews.author: Jack Mathews

reviews.text: If the film doesn't cross the line into inspired lunacy, the laughs are plentiful.
reviews.author: Nanciann Cherry

reviews.text: Murray has captured something that the other baby-boom comics have not -- an edge of anxiety beneath the self-satisfaction, of the disappointment and discontent that accompanies a success achieved too easily.
reviews.author: Dave Kehr

reviews.text: The film is uneven, too. Sometimes it flattens out. But most of the time it perks along entertainingly and doesn't let its ethical imperatives enshroud it in a pall of worthiness.
reviews.author: Jay Carr

reviews.text: A funny valentine with lots of laughs and warmth and some cute existential mindgames, Groundhog Day is a perfect vehicle for Bill Murray and a kick of a movie from start to finish.
reviews.author: Tom Long

reviews.text: Groundhog Day has a clever concept at its core, with a few extremely funny extrapolations. But because the jokes have to be set up by repetitions, the pattern becomes too predictable.
reviews.author: Bob Fenster

reviews.text: Groundhog Day generates enough warmth, wit, humor, sexual chemistry, and spiritual resonance to light up a whole season of Valentine's Days.
reviews.author: Andrew Sarris

reviews.text: Beneath its veneer of of caustic laughs and touching romance is a subtle but profound spiritual odyssey.
reviews.author: Dann Gire

reviews.text: Murray transmutates from annoying human being to nice guy through the course of the film, but he and his script manage to keep most of his acerbic humor intact, which is the key to keeping Murray, and the film, interesting.
reviews.author: John Scalzi

reviews.text: Sweetly slight and slightly sweet.
reviews.author: Jeff Simon

reviews.text: Groundhog Day is a three-quarters-baked idea, combining It's A Wonderful Life and a Monty Python sketch. It's a very near miss, coming as close to its comic target as its release date comes to the holiday itself.
reviews.author: Lawrence Toppman

reviews.text: Name me a recent Hollywood comedy with an original idea to its name. I thought so. Relief comes with Groundhog Day, the most delightfully refreshing and funny movie to hail from the studios in many a month.
reviews.author: Geoff Brown

reviews.text: He hasn't been this funny and endearing in half a decade. He's at his smarmy-sarcastic best here, and Groundhog Day may be the movie that salvages Mr. Murray's career.
reviews.author: Eleanor Ringel Cater

reviews.text: Think hard for a moment What always happens when bills go astray? Exactly. Someone else pays for your mistakes or you for theirs; or else justice is done after long litigation. Groundhog Day is a mixture, but a delicious one, of all three.
reviews.author: Nigel Andrews

reviews.text: Given the obvious debt to the comedies of Capra the movie could have defrosted swiftly into a puddle of sentiment Mostly it stays crisp and sharp and bracing -- thanks to the cunning tangential way the central conceit is played out.
reviews.author: Hugo Davenport

reviews.text: Not entirely witless -- just about any movie starring Murray has its good low-humor -- Groundhog Day is nevertheless a movie about redundancy that is seriously redundant itself.
reviews.author: Eleanor O'Sullivan

reviews.text: Groundhog Day offers OK Murray: not great, not awful, few huge laughs, no big lulls. It's another case of Murray outshining his material and, in the process, making the whole enterprise look better than it is.
reviews.author: Marshall Fine

reviews.text: To look back on Murray's career is to see the development of a distinct strain of American humor, which has often been misunderstood or mangled on film. In Groundhog Day, Murray and Ramis return to the source, and they get it right.
reviews.author: Michael MacCambridge

reviews.text: Dial your expectations to moderate, burrow in for the duration, and you won't be disappointed -- it ain't exactly springtime, but there are worse things than an amiable outing on a winter's night.
reviews.author: Rick Groen

reviews.text: It’s a promising idea, but scriptwriters Danny Rubin and Harold Ramis (Ramis also directed) seem to have no idea what a “better” Bill Murray would look like... in short, [he becomes] more cynical and manipulative than ever.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Gantz

reviews.text: Looking at what it became, it is a deception. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Rene Jordan

reviews.text: Anything with Bill Murray in it is worth seeing, and he's a hoot in the film's first half... But Groundhog Day fails apart somewhere in the middle.
reviews.author: Todd Camp

reviews.text: Ironically, given the theme of the film, this never gets old. Winning performances, and respect for the comedic value of the script delivers laughs every time.
reviews.author: Caroline Westbrook

reviews.text: Its flaw is that it leads to an arbitrary story, the humor of which is born entirely from dramatically misarticulated repetitions. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Augusto Martínez Torres

reviews.text: No film has understood [Bill Murray] better than Harold Ramis' brilliant Groundhog Day, a hilarious and unexpectedly profound comedy that breaks him down and reveals every conceivable facet of his personality.
reviews.author: Scott Tobias

reviews.text: Groundhog Day is that rarest of cinematic pleasures -- a major studio Hollywood comedy that both delights and surprises.
reviews.author: Ben Thompson

reviews.text: Groundhog Day is more than simply a great comedy - it's a modern metaphor for the path to enlightenment.
reviews.author: Betsy Bozdech

reviews.text: I find it a masterpiece of comedic timing that ultimately starts with the deceptively brilliant script from Danny Rubin.
reviews.author: Jim Rohner

reviews.text: On top of the time travel elements, Groundhog Day is also a hilarious comedy and beautiful romance. While we get to know Phil throughout the film, you also get to know Rita and what a complex person she is...
reviews.author: Sarah Brinks

reviews.text: One of those rare cinematic occasions when extreme repetition only gets funnier.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: The movie would be nothing without Murray's superb performance... Keep an eye on how his character develops in depth and self-awareness as he desperately looks for a way out of the rut.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: A great comedy with a solid message that doesn't hinder the delivery of the comedy.
reviews.author: Richard Propes

reviews.text: Re-watching Groundhog Day yet again was pretty enlightening, actually!
reviews.author: Tasha Robinson

reviews.text: Cult leader Keith Ranieri was my grade school classmate. What do we call his current prison situation? We call it "Groundhog day." Perhaps millennials aren't familiar with the facts about when and how this term became part of America's cultural lexicon...
reviews.author: Mark Jackson

reviews.text: It would be impossible to understand the movie without that casual and inevitable tone delivered by Ramis and Murray. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Sergio Benítez

reviews.text: Murray's performance doesn't only elevate the film to a completely different level but also elevates the work being put in by the rest of the cast.
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: With his shifts from smugness to weirdness to some kind of local heroism, Murray controls the picture throughout. But Ramis works ably with his oddly assorted supporting cast.
reviews.author: Malcolm Johnson

reviews.text: Are we all just wasting time squandering eternity? The film doesn't make this accusation lightly. And it takes an outrageous concept, a big premise with a science-fiction spin, to level the idea in terms we accept and understand.
reviews.author: Calum Marsh

reviews.text: Ramis and Murray achieve a harmony of wit and wisdom that works so effortlessly on you, on us all, the phrase "Groundhog Day" in American vernacular has become a synonym for dj vu.
reviews.author: Rubin Safaya

reviews.text: Murray, more often than not, is pretty unbearable; but here, playing a man who is unbearable, Murray begins convincingly, amusingly, and gets even more amusing as he metamorphoses.
reviews.author: Stanley Kauffmann

reviews.text: Harold Ramis's direction is nothing special, yet there is a beautiful, lip-smacking efficiency in the way that a great idea is touched off and followed to its conclusion.
reviews.author: Anthony Lane

reviews.text: When it comes to existential drama comedies about self realizations in a fantastic setting, [it] is right up there with films like "Her" and "Eternal Sunshine."
reviews.author: Felix Vasquez Jr.

reviews.text: ...the film's forgettable, padded-out nature confirms its place as a promising yet disposable high-concept comedy.
reviews.author: David Nusair

reviews.text: The day is not a redo; it's a "one more."
reviews.author: Kimberly Gadette

reviews.text: While Murray's deadpan putdowns and dry dismissals of provincial peccadilloes are the comic highlights, Groundhog Day is no supercilious rip of small-town U.S.A.
reviews.author: Duane Byrge

reviews.text: Precise and smart and fussed over without feeling fussy.
reviews.author: Tim Brayton

reviews.text: The legacy film of director Harold Ramis.
reviews.author: Josh Larsen

reviews.text: Director Harold Ramis uses every cinematic trick in the book to keep what is essentially a one-gag movie brimming with life and fresh ideas.
reviews.author: David Parkinson

reviews.text: Groundhog Day is surprisingly inventive.
reviews.author: People Staff

reviews.text: MacDowell was never more convincing and Chris Elliott is a dry delight as her lens-man. Murray and movie, meanwhile, are a mutual godsend: Groundhog Day rescued his career from calcifying in self-caricature.
reviews.author: Kevin Harley

reviews.text: Groundhog Day may not be the funniest collaboration between Bill Murray and director Harold Ramis... Yet this gentle, small-scale effort is easily the most endearing film of both men's careers, a sweet and amusing surprise package.
reviews.author: Kenneth Turan

reviews.text: Bill Murray and Andie MacDowell have a ball with the main roles.
reviews.author: David Sterritt

reviews.text: Murray hasn't made a comedy this winningly dumb and smart and -- yes -- sweet in a long time. If, indeed, he ever has.
reviews.author: Steven Rea

reviews.text: Groundhog Day is a good vehicle for Murray, tailored to his deadpan style, and should please fans disappointed by some the comedian's recent movies.
reviews.author: Gary Thompson

reviews.text: A movie that continually replays a single day could quickly become tedious but, strangely enough, Groundhog Day never does.
reviews.author: Jay Boyar

reviews.text: Murray's wiseacre persona is perfect for what could be saccharine material in other hands.
reviews.author: Gene Siskel

reviews.text: The movie is expertly calculated to derive maximum comic energy from Bill Murray's great, deadpan mug and his drop-dead I'm-not-impressed line readings.
reviews.author: Stephen Hunter

reviews.text: Even if you applaud Bill Murray's evolution from inspired comedian to minimalist seriocomic actor, it's a relief to revisit his most varied and charming role as Phil Connors.
reviews.author: Michael Sragow

reviews.text: Bill Murray is the one veteran of the Saturday Night Live/SCTV axis who still knows how to enter into a giddy conspiracy with his audience.
reviews.author: Owen Gleiberman

reviews.text: Bill Murray is in top form at this charming romantic comedy fantasy, well directed by Harold Ramis
reviews.author: Emanuel Levy

reviews.text: Reminds one of Capra's It's A Wonderful Life.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: A witty, sarcastic take on redemption.
reviews.author: Randy White

reviews.text: A memorable comedy for the ages, Groundhog Day digs deeper than most magic-realist comedies... [Blu-ray]
reviews.author: Peter Canavese

reviews.text: Comic perfection.
reviews.author: Ian Nathan

reviews.text: Considering that none of the characters is fresh or interesting, it's a commendable achievement that the quality of the storytelling alone keeps the movie watchable and likable.
reviews.author: Jonathan Rosenbaum

reviews.text: [A] great American comedy.
reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Anderson

reviews.text: [Murray] carries Groundhog Day with his uniquely frittery nonchalance and makes the movie a comic time warp anyone should be happy to get stuck in.
reviews.author: Richard Corliss

reviews.text: Groundhog Day is an immensely enjoyable fable.
reviews.author: TV Guide Staff

reviews.text: Ramis' direction is often too cool and restrained. He wisely avoids playing into the tale's underlying sentimentality.
reviews.author: Richard Natale

reviews.text: As well as a perfect star vehicle, the film is a brilliant analysis of the implications of the film's simple conceit.
reviews.author: Film4 Staff

reviews.text: The film endures largely because of the appeal of both its story line and the cast.
reviews.author: Kent Turner

reviews.text: The movie deserves its fans, earns our respect, delivers richly on its initial promises if not always on its greater ones, and rewards multiple viewings, even as it carries a built-in joke about the typical shelf-life of repeated experience.
reviews.author: Nick Davis

reviews.text: Since arriving as a mild success in 1993, Groundhog Day has gradually achieved the status of beloved. The American Film Institute rates it No.34 on its list of all-time funniest movies, and it's a story that bears frequent repeat viewings.
reviews.author: Michael Booth

reviews.text: Ramis directs this surreal suburban fantasy with an admirably light touch, revelling in its absurd repetitions, surprising us with narrative ellipses, and allowing Murray ample space to indulge his special mix of sarcasm and smarm.
reviews.author: Geoff Andrew

reviews.text: This is a beautiful film. On the surface, a rolling ball, a silly comedy, a farce even. But a closer look, a closer look, reveals a beauty easily not seen.
reviews.author: Ross Anthony

reviews.text: A blazingly imaginative experience.
reviews.author: Phil Villarreal

reviews.text: Groundhog Day will take you on an oddball holiday away from mainstream comedy.
reviews.author: Linda Cook

reviews.text: A marginal success, but it could have been a complete one if the people behind the camera did as good a job as those in front of it.
reviews.author: Michael Dequina

reviews.text: Mr. Murray is back in top form with a clever, varied role that draws upon the full range of his talents.
reviews.author: Janet Maslin

reviews.text: This is one of the best comedies I have ever seen.
reviews.author: Robert Roten

reviews.text: Ramis respects his audience's intelligence every step of the way. No plot point is overexplained, and when the film touches on the spiritual, it becomes neither soppy nor dogmatic.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Westhoff

reviews.text: Romantic, thoughtful and packed with incredibly hilarious moments for the entire cast, Groundhog Day is one of the best comedies that the past twenty years have produced.
reviews.author: James Rocchi

reviews.text: What places it in the pantheon of great Hollywood comedies is that it manages to be wildly humorous without being moronic, romantic without being cloying, and meaningful without being preachy.
reviews.author: Mike Gregory

reviews.text: The thing that I probably liked best about this movie was that it took a premise that could get redundant after a while, but kept spinning it into new directions.
reviews.author: JoBlo

reviews.text: In an interesting twist on reincarnation, Phil keeps coming back to the same day until he gets it right.
reviews.author: Frederic and Mary Ann Brussat

reviews.text: Brilliant, quirky, good-natured, and smart are just some of the adjectives that we film critics don't get to use often enough, but all of them apply to Groundhog Day.
reviews.author: David Bezanson

reviews.text: An inventive and consistently humorous movie that depends on the ultimate gimmick.
reviews.author: Brian Webster

reviews.text: I liked Groundhog Day quite a bit, with its shades of old Scrooge and its eternal philosophical questions of why we’re here and what we’re up to.
reviews.author: John J. Puccio

reviews.text: ...We take pleasure in screenwriters [Harold] Ramis and Danny Rubin out-fantasizing us.
reviews.author: Bill Chambers

reviews.text: Something very rare in today's Hollywood -- a film that is in the same time very funny and very humane, thought-provoking yet entertaining.
reviews.author: Dragan Antulov

reviews.text: [A] brilliantly imaginative, wildly funny new comedy starring Bill Murray.
reviews.author: Hal Hinson

reviews.text: Groundhog will never be designated a national film treasure by the Library of Congress. But, in terms of vehicle selection, this is one of the better ones Murray has hitched himself to.
reviews.author: Desson Thomson

reviews.text: This movie has all the qualities necessary to be a crowd-pleaser: likable characters, charismatic performers, a strong, capably-executed premise, and lots of laughs.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: Funny and well-acted, Groundhog Day should be seen for both its comic and sci-fi elements.
reviews.author: James O'Ehley

reviews.text: The film is lovable and sweet.
reviews.author: Roger Ebert

reviews.text: Ramis has an intriguing premise taken just about as far as it could be taken. It is pleasant but not particularly deep.
reviews.author: Mark R. Leeper

reviews.text: Ramis wisely unravels his plot, using both variation and repetition to terrific effect, as you know what is coming but not exactly how it is going to happen. It's all believable, in a way.
reviews.author: Louis Black

reviews.text: One would hardly expect Murray and Ramis to come up with a gentle, sweet-natured romantic comedy that wanders into high-minded Frank Capra territory.
reviews.author: Chris Hicks

synopsis: Phil (Bill Murray), a weatherman, is out to cover the annual emergence of the groundhog from its hole. He gets caught in a blizzard that he didn't predict and finds himself trapped in a time warp. He is doomed to relive the same day over and over again until he gets it right.
